data

Class PostSong

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.Song
      • data.PostSong

  • public class PostSong
extends Song
    Represents a song but from a Reddit post JSON. More processing involved (including YouTube API).
    Author:
    Yohan Chalier

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class data.Song

        artist, dislikes, domain, DOMAIN_FILTER, downs, fame, genre, genres, id, likes, nExtComments, nRedditComments, quality, thumbnail, title, ups, url, views

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PostSong(org.json.JSONObject json)
      Builds a song given a JSON object representing the song in a Reddit post.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void parseGenre(java.lang.String genreString)
      Split all genres provided by the OP, and then process them through a basic IE engine.
      private void parseTitle(java.lang.String title)
      Interpret post title to extract the artist, the title, the genre(s) and the year.

      • Methods inherited from class data.Song

        comparator, meanScore, toJSON, toString, toStringGenres

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • PostSong

        public PostSong(org.json.JSONObject json)
         throws SongException
        Builds a song given a JSON object representing the song in a Reddit post.
        Parameters:
        json - The direct element from Reddit post. Corresponds to the "data" field of an element from the JSONArray.
        Throws:
        SongException

    • Method Detail

      • parseTitle

        private void parseTitle(java.lang.String title)
                 throws SongException
        Interpret post title to extract the artist, the title, the genre(s) and the year. Year is optional (null if not found).
        Parameters:
        title - Reddit post title (given by OP)
        Throws:
        SongException

      • parseGenre

        private void parseGenre(java.lang.String genreString)
                 throws SongException
        Split all genres provided by the OP, and then process them through a basic IE engine.
        Parameters:
        genreString - Song genre with the following format: "genre 1/genre 2" or "genre 1, genre 2"
        Throws:
        SongException
        See Also:
        Genre
